name.text: 9.2.1.5 Adding vectors written in component form

questiontext.text:
It is very important to note from the last task that vectors in Cartesian form can be added by simply adding their respective \(\underline{ i}\) and \(\underline{ j}\) components.


Thus, if \(\underline{ a}=a_x\underline{ i} + a_y\underline{ j}\) and \(\underline{ b}=b_x\underline{ i}+b_y\underline{ j}\) then \[\underline{ a}+\underline{ b}=(a_x+b_x)\underline{ i}+ (a_y+b_y)\underline{ j}.\] A similar, and obvious, rule applies when subtracting: \[\underline{ a}-\underline{ b}=(a_x-b_x)\underline{ i}+(a_y-b_y)\underline{ j}.\]
